    • Method Detail

      • createMission

        public WrappedResponse<MissionResponse> createMission(Long accountId,
                                             String title,
                                             Long startDate,
                                             Long endDate,
                                             Boolean active,
                                             List<Long> gameLevelIds,
                                             List<Long> audienceIds,
                                             Long offerId,
                                             Double balance)
                                               throws SirqulException
        Create a user defined mission.

        Target API Endpoint: /mission/create
        Parameters:
        accountId - The logged in user's account id.
        title - The title of the mission
        startDate - the date/time to start the mission
        endDate - the date/time to end the mission
        active - activate/deactivate the mission
        gameLevelIds - list of game level ids to include in the mission
        audienceIds - the audience ids
        offerId - the offer id to give as a reward
        balance - Set the amount of money available to spend, once 0 deactivate mission. Set to a negative value for unlimited.
        Returns:
        error SirqulResponse, success a wrapped MissionResponse
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • findAds

        public WrappedResponse<List<MissionResponse>> findAds(String appKey,
                                             String suffix,
                                             Long accountId,
                                             AppVersion appVersion,
                                             Location location,
                                             String device,
                                             String deviceVersion,
                                             Integer start,
                                             Integer limit,
                                             Boolean includeScores,
                                             Boolean includeGameData,
                                             Boolean includeAudiences,
                                             Boolean allocatesTickets)
                                               throws SirqulException
        Get a set of missions filtered by the parameters provided.

        Target API Endpoint: /ads/find
        Parameters:
        appKey - The application key, if provided return missions specific for the app. Will always return mission levels that are app agnostic.
        suffix - The type of mission to get.
        accountId - The logged in user.
        appVersion - The version of the application, will not return levels newer than the appVersion.
        location - The current location of the requesting device
        device - The name of the requesting device; possible values are:
        Android, iPhone, iPad, iPod, PC, OSX, WEBPLAYER
        deviceVersion - The requesting device version; examples are:
        2.3, 5.1.4, 6.1.4. Supports X, X.X, or X.X.X formated string.
        start - The index into the record set to start with.
        limit - The total number of record to return.
        includeScores - the include scores
        includeGameData - Include the game level data with the misison.
        includeAudiences - If true then return the audience data in the response. Default is false.
        allocatesTickets - If true/false only return missions whose game levels allocate (or don't allocate) tickets. Do not provide a value to return both.
        Returns:
        a WrappedResponse<List<MissionResponse >> on success, SirqulResponse on failure.
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • findMissions

        public WrappedResponse<List<MissionResponse>> findMissions(String appKey,
                                                  String suffix,
                                                  Long accountId,
                                                  AppVersion appVersion,

                                                  String device,

                                                  Boolean includeGameData,
                                                  Boolean includeAudiences,
                                                  Boolean allocatesTickets)
                                                    throws SirqulException
        Get a set of missions filtered by the parameters provided.

        Target API Endpoint: /mission/find
        Parameters:
        appKey - The application key, if provided return missions specific for the app. Will always return mission levels that are app agnostic.
        suffix - The type of mission to get.
        accountId - The logged in user.
        appVersion - The version of the application, will not return levels newer than the appVersion.
        location - The current location of the requesting device
        device - The name of the requesting device; possible values are:
        Android, iPhone, iPad, iPod, PC, OSX, WEBPLAYER
        deviceVersion - The requesting device version; examples are:
        2.3, 5.1.4, 6.1.4. Supports X, X.X, or X.X.X formated string.
        start - The index into the record set to start with.
        limit - The total number of record to return.
        includeScores - the include scores
        includeGameData - Include the game level data with the misison.
        includeAudiences - If true then return the audience data in the response. Default is false.
        allocatesTickets - If true/false only return missions whose game levels allocate (or don't allocate) tickets. Do not provide a value to return both.
        Returns:
        a WrappedResponse<List<MissionResponse >> on success, SirqulResponse on failure.
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • searchMissionFormats

        public SearchResponse<MissionFormatResponse> searchMissionFormats(Integer start,
                                                         Integer limit,
                                                         Boolean activeOnly)
                                                           throws SirqulException

        Searches on pre-defined mission formats.

        This information is used to generate the gameData parameter when creating a createGameLevel. A createMission can then be created using the generated game level ID.

        Possbile Mission Formats by formatType:

        (All format types require a points field. This is a digit that represents the number of points the consumer will receive upon completion of the mission.)

        • PHOTO - {"type": "photo", "albumId": %d "points":%d} - Create an album and pass in the albumId.
        • VOTE - {"type": "vote", "ids": [%s], "points": %d} - Create an album contest and pass in the albumContestId for "ids". You can pass in multiple contests by separating the IDs with a comma.
        • ASK - {"type": "ask", "albumId": %d, "points": %d} - Create an album and pass in the albumId.
        • ANSWER - {"type": "answer", "albumId": %d, "points": %d} - Create an album and pass in the albumId.
        • AD - {"type":"click","action":"%s", points:%d} - Pass in a griply link for "action".
        • GAME - This does not require Json generation. An existing game level is used when creating a mission.
        • All other types don't require anything else other than points.


        Target API Endpoint: /mission/format/search
        Parameters:
        start - The starting index in the result set to return. Default is 0.
        limit - The total number of records to return. Default is 20.
        activeOnly - Determines whether to return only active results. Default is false.
        Returns:
        SearchResponse<MissionFormatResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • searchMissions

        public WrappedResponse<MissionResponse> searchMissions(Long accountId,
                                              Integer start,
                                              Integer limit,
                                              Boolean includeGameData,
                                              Boolean includeAudiences,
                                              Boolean includeInactive)
                                                throws SirqulException
        Get the list missions available to the account.

        Target API Endpoint: /mission/search
        Parameters:
        accountId - The logged in user.
        start - The index into the record set to start with. Default is 0.
        limit - The total number of record to return. Default is 20.
        includeGameData - If true then return the game level data in the response. Defaul is false.
        includeAudiences - If true then return the audience data in the response. Default is false.
        includeInactive - If true then include inactive missions. Default is false.
        Returns:
        error SirqulResponse, success a wrapped list of MissionResponse
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • searchMissionsByBillableEntity

        public WrappedResponse<MissionResponse> searchMissionsByBillableEntity(Long accountId,
                                                              Integer start,
                                                              Integer limit,
                                                              Boolean includeGameData,
                                                              Boolean includeAudiences,
                                                              Boolean includeInactive)
                                                                throws SirqulException
        Use the accountId to determine the associated BillableEntity. From there get a list of all accounts associated as managers. Get the list missions owned by all associated managers.

        Target API Endpoint: /mission/searcharchByBillableEntity
        Parameters:
        accountId - The logged in user.
        start - The index into the record set to start with. Default is 0.
        limit - The total number of record to return. Default id 20.
        includeGameData - If true then return the game level data in the response. Default is false.
        includeAudiences - If true then return the audience data in the response. Default is false.
        includeInactive - If true then include inactive missions. Default is false.
        Returns:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse < MissionResponse>
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • updateMission

        public WrappedResponse<MissionResponse> updateMission(Long accountId,
                                             Long missionId,
                                             String title,
                                             Long startDate,
                                             Long endDate,
                                             Boolean active,
                                             List<Long> gameLevelIds,
                                             List<Long> audienceIds,
                                             Long offerId,
                                             Double balance)
                                               throws SirqulException
        Update a mission.

        Target API Endpoint: /mission/update
        Parameters:
        accountId - The logged in user's account id
        missionId - The id of the mission to update
        title - The title of the mission
        startDate - the date/time to start the mission
        endDate - the date/time to end the mission
        active - Activate/deactivate the mission
        gameLevelIds - list of game level ids to include in the mission
        audienceIds - the audience ids
        offerId - the offer id to give as a reward
        balance - Replace the amount of money available to spend, once 0 deactivate mission. Set to a negative value for unlimited.
        Returns:
        error SirqulResponse, success a wrapped MissionResponse
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.
